Oscar Nominations 2011

25/01/2011

Following its 14 BAFTA, and 7 Golden Globe nominations <em>The King's Speech</em> tops the pack at this years' Oscar nominations, clocking a total of 12.

Image by

By undefined undefined

Following its 14 BAFTA, and 7 Golden Globe nominations The King's Speech tops the pack at this years' Oscar nominations, clocking a total of 12. The second most nominated film was True Grit, a movie which didn't receive as many nominations as expected in the BAFTA or Golden Globes, but has more than made up for this with its 10 nominations today, including best picture and best director. Box-office favourites The Social Network and Inception received 8 nominations each, putting them both a step below The King's Speech which looks to dominate the ceremony this year. Surprises came in the form of Toy Story 3, as it became the third animated film to ever be nominated for the best picture award, after Beauty and the Beast and Up. Similarly Javier Bardem became the first actor in an entirely foreign language film (Biutiful) to be nominated for best actor. Many were surprised to find that Chris Nolan director of blockbuster Inception was omitted from the best director category, and that amongst the ten films up for best picture, The Town by Ben Affleck which is also included in the supporting actor category wasn't nominated. The Oscar Ceremony, which takes place on the 27th February is hosted by James Franco and Anne Hathaway. Best Motion Picture of the Year Black Swan The Fighter Inception The Kids are All Right The King's Speech The Social Network 127 Hours Toy Story 3 True Grit Winter's Bone Performance by an Actress in
